title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message:
820-3115 came in as no power. Replaced U7200 and power was restored.
Intermittent keyboard and trackpad only clicked, didn't track. Light on MagSafe would be green for 10 sec, then off for a few sec, then back to green.
Replaced U5701 and keyboard is now 100%, MagSafe LED also acts normal now. Still no tracking on the trackpad though. USB keyboard/mouse also intermittently didn't work,
Finally replaced U2700 as I get 0V on R5702. USB is now acting normal but this made no difference for the trackpad. tested with two other trackpads that show the same issue.

Not sure where to take it from here.
Board did not suffer liquid damage.

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message: Diode mode on all pins of trackpad connector.

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message: Pin 19 should be about the same as pin 17, check for corroded trace...

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message: Pin 19 has nothing to do with the trackpad working or not, it is for thermal sensor, should be fixed though. Pin 18 is a big problem as there should be something there. Corroded trace to R5800, R5800 fucked, etc.

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message: R5806 torn off by fingernail is most likely. It is right on the corner.

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message:
R5806 is present.

No R5800 on this board but checked L5800 and C5800 (assuming you made a typo) and those are not on the board. According to schematic they should be there? It doesn't mention OMIT or NOSTUFF but the pads have not been used, checked a few donor boards and they don't have those components either. No tin, scrapes or pits, just unused gold contacts.

I do get 5V where those components should be according to schematic. If none of the donor boards have them either I'm assuming the schematic is wrong here, what do you think?

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message: Oh yeah they are indeed "no stuff". Do you have 18V on R5806, trackpad must be connected when checking.

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message: There is the problem. You did check with a trackpad connected? Check Z2_BOOST_EN and power to U5805.

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message:
Yessir, trackpad was connected.
Power to U5805 5.1V (pin 2),  Z2_BOOST_EN 3.3V (pin 5)

title: 820-3115 trackpad doesn't track
message: Well, then there must be an issue with U5805 or something around it.
